page.title: 02Farming, Ceres
page.content:
Most of the farms in our area have between 300-600 acres of land.
The main crop is barley but recently some farmers have been growing oil seed rape and many have successfully introduced vegetables.
Cattle and sheep are found on most of the farms. Most of the cattle are Hereford X Friesian but there are also Charolais, Simmental and Limousin crosses. Lambs produced are mostly Suffolk crosses. The fattened animals are sold at Cupar Market to butchers.
One farm has battery hens for egg production.
All of the farmers interviewed came from farming families.
